result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio Barron-Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES or, in the alternative, serve 1 DAY in the House of Correction with credit for 1 DAY served for a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 12-24-2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

With credit for 2 DAYS served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
If the defendant commits no new crimes, the Court will grant expungement after 6 months.
Court ordered the defendant to perform 20 hours of community service; the defendant provided proof of completion of community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julio Barron-Ramirez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Julio Barron-Ramirez in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered the defendant to perform 20 hours of community service; the defendant provided proof of completion of community service.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 DAYS served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES or, in the alternative, serve 1 DAY in the House of Correction with credit for 1 DAY served for a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 12-24-2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  If the defendant commits no new crimes, the Court will grant expungement after 6 months.

Defendant Julio Barron-Ramirez in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julio Barron-Ramirez in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Julio Barron-Ramirez in court with attorney Kathleen Judith Osvat.  Defendant Julio Barron-Ramirez in custody.  
Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.    Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
